News.Title: AGI Greenpac Q3FY26 Results & Strategic Expansion
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac reported Q3FY26 consolidated revenue of ₹633.69 crore with net profit of ₹71.45 crore. Company announced retail business diversification and key leadership appointments.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Shareholders Approve Rs 1,500 Crore Fund Raising Through Postal Ballot
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited shareholders have approved two special resolutions through postal ballot voting. The first resolution approves raising funds up to Rs 1,500 crore through issuance of securities. The second resolution approves alteration in the object clause of the company's Memorandum of Association. Out of 56,285 eligible members holding 64,697,381 equity shares, 286 shareholders holding 4,27,94,949 equity shares participated in the remote e-voting process. Both resolutions were passed with the requisite majority of more than three-fourths of votes from participating members. The voting period was from October 8, 2025 to November 6, 2025, with results declared on November 7, 2025. Pravin Kumar Drolia served as the scrutinizer for the postal ballot process.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Reports Q2 FY2026 Financial Results with Mixed Performance
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited announced its unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the second quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The company's consolidated revenue from operations decreased to ₹601.58 crore in Q2 from ₹687.66 crore in the previous quarter, while showing growth from ₹599.18 crore in the same quarter last year. For the half year, total revenue reached ₹1,289.24 crore compared to ₹1,165.51 crore in the previous year. Profit before tax for Q2 was ₹100.85 crore versus ₹117.79 crore in the previous quarter. The packaging products segment generated ₹596.20 crore in revenue during Q2. The company received ₹20.49 crore from insurance claims related to production facility disruption at its Hyderabad unit due to furnace crown collapse. Additionally, the company provided ₹12.22 crore against cross-subsidy surcharge demand from Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company for the period April 2015 to June 2016, against which it has filed a writ petition. The results were approved by the Board of Directors on October 18, 2025.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Board Approves Rs. 1,500 Crore Fundraising Plan Through Multiple Securities
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Ltd's Board of Directors approved a proposal to raise funds up to Rs. 1,500 crore through various securities including equity shares, convertible debentures, warrants, and other eligible instruments. The fundraising will be conducted through permissible modes such as private placement, preferential issue, or qualified institutions placement in one or more tranches. The board also approved alteration of the main object clause in the company's Memorandum of Association to include manufacturing and dealing in metal packaging materials, particularly aluminum cans. Additionally, the board amended the insider trading code and approved issuance of a postal ballot notice for shareholder approval. The Corporate Affairs Committee has been authorized to handle decisions related to the proposed fund raising. All proposals are subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Limited Schedules Board Meeting to Consider Fund Raising Proposal
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited has scheduled a Board of Directors meeting on September 30, 2025, to consider and evaluate a proposal for raising funds through issuance of various securities. The fund raising options include equity shares, fully or partially convertible debentures, non-convertible debentures, warrants, global depository receipts, american depository receipts, foreign currency convertible bonds, or other eligible securities. The issuance may be conducted in one or more tranches through permissible modes including private placement, preferential issue, qualified institutions placement, or other methods as deemed appropriate by the Board. The proposal is subject to statutory and regulatory approvals, including shareholder approval. The company has also closed its trading window for designated persons and their immediate relatives until further notice. The outcome of the board meeting will be communicated to stock exchanges after the meeting concludes.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Announces Rs 47 Crore Capacity Expansion for Glass Production Facilities
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited is undertaking two de-bottlenecking exercises to expand its glass production capacity. The Container Glass Facility will be increased from 1,850 TPD to 1,900 TPD, and the Speciality Glass Facility from 154 TPD to 200 TPD. The expansion involves a total capital expenditure of Rs 47 crore, with Rs 32 crore allocated for the container glass facility and Rs 15 crore for the specialty glass facility. Both facilities are expected to be operational by March 2026. The company will finance the expansion through internal accruals. The container glass expansion aims to meet high-volume demand in alcohol-beverage, food, pharma and chemical segments, while the specialty glass expansion targets increased demand in premium market segments including cosmetics, perfumery, and luxury beverages. Current capacity utilization stands at 92% for the container glass facility and 78% for the specialty glass facility.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Faces ₹41-Crore Power Demand Notice, Approaches Supreme Court
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited received a demand notice of ₹40.61 crore from Southern Power Distribution Company of Telangana Limited (TGSPDCL) for surplus power procured from Andhra Pradesh Gas Power Corporation Ltd (APGPCL). The demand covers power drawn in excess of contracted quantum between 2002 and 2022. AGI Greenpac, as a beneficial shareholder under a group captive power arrangement, had procured surplus power from APGPCL and made direct payments at applicable rates. The company states that TGSPDCL issued the demand notice without considering payments already made to APGPCL. AGI Greenpac has filed a special leave petition before the Supreme Court of India, which has been admitted and is pending. The company's shares closed at ₹933.35, down 0.36%.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Reports 25% Revenue Growth to ₹721 Crore in Q1 FY26, Announces ₹1,000 Crore Aluminum Cans Investment
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited delivered strong quarterly results with total income rising 25% year-on-year to ₹721 crore compared to ₹577 crore in Q1 FY25. Net profit surged 41% to ₹89 crore from ₹63 crore, while EBITDA increased 20% to ₹176 crore from ₹147 crore. The company operates at over 95% capacity utilization across existing plants and projects 8-10% growth for FY26. The Board approved a strategic entry into aluminum cans manufacturing with a ₹1,000 crore investment in two phases for a new plant in Uttar Pradesh, expected to be operational by Q3 FY28 with initial capacity of 950 million cans, expanding to 1.6 billion by FY30. The company also announced a ₹700 crore glass expansion in Madhya Pradesh, adding 500-ton daily capacity and increasing overall production by 25%. As of June 30, 2025, gross debt stood at ₹470 crore with cash balance of ₹263 crore, resulting in net debt of ₹207 crore. The company prepaid ₹193.5 crore of term loans in July 2025. Management targets sustained 15-20% growth from FY27 onwards and aims to double the top line every 4 years.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Targets 26% Ebitda Margin by FY26 with Rs 1,700 Crore Capex Plan
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac aims to achieve an Ebitda margin of around 26% in FY26, driven by improved capacity utilization beyond 95%. Group CFO Sandeep Sikka stated the company maintains long-term Ebitda margin guidance of 22% to 25%. The company expects 10% topline growth through FY27, with 8% to 10% growth projected for FY26. AGI Greenpac plans Rs 1,700 crore in capital expenditure, including Rs 700 crore for 25% glass capacity expansion and strategic investments in aluminum can production. The capex will be funded 60% through debt and 40% through internal accruals. The company reported 41% year-on-year net profit growth to Rs 89 crore in quarterly results, with Ebitda rising 20% to Rs 176 crore. AGI Greenpac is exploring global markets for specialty glass applications and may raise equity closer to new facility launches. Shares surged 14.08% to Rs 966 following the announcement.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Approves Q1 FY2026 Results and Plans Rs 1,000 Crore Aluminum Beverage Can Manufacturing Expansion
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac Limited's Board approved standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue of Rs 687.66 crore compared to Rs 566.33 crore in the same quarter last year. Profit before tax stood at Rs 117.79 crore versus Rs 84.39 crore in the previous year quarter. The Board approved diversification into aluminum beverage can manufacturing with a new facility in Uttar Pradesh. The project involves total capital expenditure of Rs 1,000 crore, with the first phase requiring Rs 850 crore to produce 950 million cans by Q3 FY2028, and full capacity of 1.6 billion cans by March 2030. The company received Rs 20.49 crore from insurance claims related to production facility damage at its Hyderabad unit. The 65th Annual General Meeting has been rescheduled to August 29, 2025, with the record date for dividend payment set as August 22, 2025.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Plans 10 Billion Rupee Investment in Aluminum Can Manufacturing Facility
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac plans to invest 10 billion rupees in aluminum can production in Uttar Pradesh by Q3 of FY28. The plant will begin operations with an annual production capacity of 950 million aluminum cans, with plans to expand capacity to 1.6 billion cans by FY 2030.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Reports 40% Jump in Q1 Net Profit to 888 Million Rupees
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac delivered strong quarterly results with net profit rising to 888 million rupees compared to 632 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue grew to 6.88 billion rupees from 5.7 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA increased to 1.42 billion rupees from 1.36 billion rupees, though EBITDA margin declined to 20.65% from 24.09% in the previous year.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Reports Q4 Results and Dividend Recommendation
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac has announced its Q4 financial results and dividend recommendation. The company's Q4 net profit increased to 966 million rupees from 645.8 million rupees year-over-year. Revenue rose to 7 billion rupees from 6.22 billion rupees. EBITDA slightly improved to 1.5 billion rupees, although the EBITDA margin decreased to 21.84% from 23.72%. The company has recommended a dividend of 7 rupees per equity share.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac: Supreme Court Rejects HNG Acquisition Plan
News.Summary: The Supreme Court has rejected AGI Greenpac's resolution plan for acquiring Hindustan National Glass (HNG), citing it as unsustainable. The court mandated that CCI approval must precede CoC voting for resolution plans involving combinations. Fresh resolution plans for HNG's acquisition will now be considered. AGI Greenpac's shares fell sharply following the news.

News.Title: AGI Greenpac Ltd: Supreme Court Rejects Resolution Plan for Hindusthan National Glass
News.Summary: AGI Greenpac's shares fell 17% after the Supreme Court rejected its ₹2,213 crore resolution plan for Hindusthan National Glass & Industries Ltd. The plan was previously approved by 98% of the Committee of Creditors in October 2022.
